abstract: Obama administration announces it has decided greater sage grouse should not be listed as endangered species, noting that efforts by officials and environmentalists have been sufficient to ensure bird's survival; listing, if carried out, could have damaged oil and natural gas interests as well as local economies across 11 Western states where bird roams.
lead_paragraph: The compromise was reached with environmental groups and industry but drew criticism that it did not go far enough to protect the bird known for its courtship strut.

headline.main: U.S. Trying to Protect Sage Grouse Without Listing It as an Endangered Species
headline.print_headline: U.S. Rules Grouse Is Not Endangered, in Environment-Business Accord

snippet: The compromise was reached with environmental groups and industry but drew criticism that it did not go far enough to protect the bird known for its courtship strut.
